alert.note: Alert for Boone; Hendricks; Marion; Putnam; Tipton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 06 at 3:01AM EST until March 06 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EST FOR NORTHERN HENDRICKS...NORTHWESTERN MARION...SOUTHERN BOONE... HAMILTON...SOUTHERN TIPTON AND NORTHERN PUTNAM COUNTIES... At 301 AM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Zionsville, or 16 miles northwest of Indianapolis, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Carmel, Westfield, Morse Reservoir, Fishers, Noblesville, Cicero and Arcadia. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 123 and 136. Interstate 69 between mile markers 205 and 210. Interstate 74 between mile markers 52 and 68. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
